definition: to fall and fracture (a leg, vertebra etc)
to fall/to tumble/to trip/(of prices etc) to drop/Taiwan pr. [die2]
to break/to snap/to cut off/to give up or abstain from sth/to judge/(usu. used in the negative) absolutely/definitely/decidedly

sentences.english: I slipped on the icy road and broke my right leg.
sentences.chinese: 我在结冰的路上滑了一跤，跌断了右腿。

sentences.english: Josh broke a bone when he fell off his bicycle.
sentences.chinese: 乔希从自行车上摔了下来，跌断了一根骨头。

definition: to fall and break/to break (bones) by falling
to injure oneself in a fall
to fall down/to take a fall
variant of 跌跤[die1 jiao1]
paralysis of one side of the body/hemiplegia
high, lofty/precipitous
to sprain (one's ankle)/see 崴子[wai3 zi5]
broken leg
to limp/lame person
to fall and smash into pieces
to fall to one's death
to fall/fig. to suffer a setback
to limp/lame/crippled
to lose one's footing/to slip/to take a wrong step in life
to break by twisting
lumbar vertebrae
to snap sth off/to break
